oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The effects of vegetated buffer zones on erosion and nutrients in surface runoff
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Uusi-K채mpp채, Jaana
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Air and water emissions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The buffer zones seem to be one tool in mitigating erosion and total nutrient losses from surface runoff on clay soils. However, to decrease the dissolved reactive phosphorus losses, the vegetation of buffer zones should be cut and the residue removed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Uusi-K채mpp채, Jaana (2008) The effects of vegetated buffer zones on erosion and nutrients in surface runoff. Paper at: Mitigation options for nutrient reduction in surface water and groundwaters : COST Action 869, Waidhofen, Austria, 18th-22th May, 2008.
